summary: This is an internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email indicates the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting the affidavit, with plans to execute the search around August 11-15, 2019.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The search warrant is being drafted for his private island off St. Thomas, indicating he is the central subject of the investigation.

persons.name: SSA- Squad C-20
persons.context: The sender of the initial email coordinating the search warrant operation for the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York.

connections.description: The FBI agent is coordinating the execution of a search warrant on Epstein's private island as part of an investigation.

events.title: Expected search warrant swearing
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) expects to have the search warrant for Epstein's island sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: The FBI team plans to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's island.

events.title: Search warrant execution period
events.description: The search of Epstein's island is expected to take 1-3 days, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).

events.title: Planned FBI return travel
events.description: The FBI team plans to return home from St. Thomas after completing the search operation.

locations: New York (FBI New York field office)
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) in New York was coordinating the search operation.
The search was planned to occur between August 11-15, 2019, using the FBI's Q400 aircraft for transportation.
The FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT) was designated to manage the search, which was expected to take 1-3 days.
This email shows active FBI investigation into Epstein's activities shortly before his death in August 2019.
